scenes.location: THE VENUE, BEHIND THE STAGE NIGHT 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a story that hums like neon and moves like electricity and reverberates like an echo. Lights flash: disorienting, rhythmic and eerie. They bring with them cheering (all female voices). The strobing lights slow do enough to illuminate three Hard Women. They stand in a battle-ready position, bathed in differen color lights from every direction, blinking on/off. An electric haze of mismatched bulbs, signs, spotlights, reflections consolidated into a haze of color.  The crowd’s chanting is rising and rising.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY. BECKY. BECKY. BECKY.
dialogues.text: Center: BECKY SOMETHING. Peroxide blonde, smeared everyth on her face from the preceding hour of show. Sweaty hair smashed to forehead. Glitter all over her face. Becky Something is a rock goddess nearing the end of her reign at the top. You can see in her glassy half-gone eye that Becky is doped up. Becky ticks her head back and forth in rhythm to people chanting her name, closes her eyes, really digs it, throw a pair of middle fingers to the ladies flanking her.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: (under breath, quietly) I always flirt with death. On one side: MARIELLE HELL. Bass. (Mari, casually.) Mari super chill, dark, mysterious, smoking, half the mess tha Becky is and with none of the hang ups. The long term relationship with her girlfriend is proof that she can succeed as a fun time drug user rock star where Becky can The other side: ALI VAN DER WOLFF. Drums. Dependable, san sober. Ali keeps the rhythm and the band on track. She handles business while Mari and Becky are using. Ali is f devoid of her partners darkness and perpetually has that denied her by the sinking ship she is stuck on, with no l preserver.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (under breath/half- singing) I always flirt with death. The crowd still chants and when the fever pitch has been reached, Becky, Ali and Mari storm the stage to cheers. Encore time at last. Becky steps into the spotlight, a ha forming around her from the bright hair. All three have fans blowing their hair, adding to the dramatic effect. Behind them is a banner with the band’s and logo: SOMETHING SHE. THE VENUE, THE STAGE — CONTINUOUS 2

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: It’s not over. No. I’m not fuckin’ finished. You know this one. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You love it. You want it. I always flirt with death! (singing, no backup) I always flirt with death. I look ill but I don’t care about it. Becky looks to Ali and Mari, Ali gives a drumstick countd Becky takes it from the top. Rough, raw and beautiful: grinding rock sung with feminine aggression. Crowd goes n (It is ‘Another Girl, Another Planet’ by The Only Ones.)

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (singing) I always flirt with death I look ill but I don’t care about it I can face your threats and stand up Straight and tall and shout about it I think I’m on another world with you With you. I’m on another planet with you You get under my skin I don’t find it irritating You always play to win But I won’t need rehabilitating oh no I think I’m on another world with you With you I’m on another planet with you. Another girl. Another planet. Another girl. Another planet. Becky’s drugged out/stage adrenaline euphoria is a thing behold as she sings, snarls and wails on her guitar. Mari looks cool as anything, cigarette dangling as she plays b

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Space travel’s in my blood There ain’t nothing I can do about it Long journeys wear me out But I don’t care anything about it. I think I’m on another world with you With you I’m on another planet with you. Another girl, who’se loving you now? Another planet, is holding you down. Another planet. Here, on stage, you see the extent to which Becky fancies herself a god. Not a rock god(dess) but an actual, untouchable, invincible god.  4. Becky is way lost in her illusions but the band sounds gr She holds it together when get sloppy and she misses a no or word here or there. The song ends and Becky drops her guitar. Screeching feed wails as the crowd goes nuts and she stumbles, dizzy and headsick, off the stage banging into things and colliding with the wall and twirling. (Feedback continues....)

dialogues.speaker: THE VENUE, BACKSTAGE
dialogues.text: Follow from behind as Becky stumbles down a long, fluores lit corridor with humming and buzzing lights everywhere a the ringing of feedback and crowd sounds fading slowly, though the feedback lingers because it’s in her head too. Becky is light headed from a combination of exhaustion, a head rush, adrenaline all augmented with dope. KAT, an assistant, appears from nowhere to give her water and a t to wipe face and sweat. She uses it to half deliberately smear her makeup even further. Becky gives no fucks. You see the way the silent assistant treats Becky: eggshe at all times. Becky throws the towel at Kat as Mari catch up, gives them a knowing nod and flicks her cigarette awa Kat is gone like a whisp of smoke as Mari and Becky duck a dressing room that says ‘SOMETHING SHE’ on the door and close it mostly, open just a crack.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: I am a free woman. No more fuckin’ tour. (ref: Wayne’s World) Party time!

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Excellent!

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Right this way my pretty. Ali catches up to the door and looks in the crack, watchi her bandmates pour booze and remove little foil packages drugs. Ali brushes her own sweaty hair back as Kat reappe with a bottle of water. Clean living Ali. Kat is now also holding a baby of like 1 1/2. She stands to Ali and peers into the door crack as well. Ali looks a from the door to Kat, at the baby, full of agonizing sadn for the life Becky has created for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Kat. I'll take her. Did she eat?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: An hour ago. Ali holds Becky's baby, lovingly, tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Hello baby. Mommy’s busy right now so aunt Ali’s gonna play with you. Kat hands over some forms, paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: The venue needs these signed.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: I’ll handle it. Ali sticks an arm out and Kat wedges them under. Ali walk with the baby to the next dressing room down. THE VENUE, ALI’S DRESSING ROOM - CONTINUOUS 4 Ali catches her reflection in the mirror and puts down th paperwork. It’s clear that the sight of herself holding a baby gives her a rise and she holds for a moment. It’s a quiet lull before Hurricane Becky storms in just as Ali starts to sign the official forms on behalf of the band. Ali sees Becky come in to this room via the mirror and no Becky is twice as gauzy as before and has a half crazy ha disoriented look on her face as she goes right for the ba

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: There's my little princess Tama. Momma missed you. Momma missed you! Ali instinctually hesitates, holds the baby away which ma Becky give her a confused, lost look but then it passes a Ali hands the baby to Becky, who deeply loves her. Becky holds Tama, kisses her, but Becky herself is such a slopp looking mess that as Ali steps back to watch it, there’s something painfully tragic and hopeless about this messed Madonna and child tableau that Ali wants to scream.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There she is, the princess. Danny brought her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Kat had her.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Danny’s not here?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Haven't seen him.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Did he not see the show and is Ya-Ema here?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Beck. C’mon. I don’t know. Becky is mile a minute. Ali has to keep up. Here’s the pattern with Becky: she has next to no idea about the wor around her, her awareness is dim and nothing gets through Kat enters. Nervous, always ready to be yelled at.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: There you are.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Here the fuck am I but where’s Danny’s where’s Ya-Ema?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Danny’s saying goodbye to people. Ali has forms the venue wanted sign-

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: And was she with him?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: She was.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: (to nobody) I want her away from my kid. (as if a new girlfriend is worse than this squalor.)

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now is he gonna come pick her up tonight or am I supposed to or what’s happening because we have that thing tomorrow so he’ll have to come pick her up first thing in the AY-EM. (yelling) Ya-Ema! You here? Show yourself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I assumed you worked it out with him.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: That’s not true. That’s not true. I hadn’t worked it out. That’s not true. An imposing, strikingly handsome black man appears in the room. He is YA-EMA, Becky’s shaman/spiritual guru of indistinct beliefs. He is dressed in mystical ways: a big amulet around his neck, some sort of a curious hat.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ya-Ema, darling! Becky need guidance.

dialogues.speaker: YA-EMA
dialogues.text: (nodding, confident) Dymoke prepares.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: (to Ali) Time to exit this realm for a spell. If you see anything you identify as a pollutant to the energy of this space our mortal husks occupy let us KNOW so we can purge it while we have all the tools and the KNOW HOW to save us. Ya- Ema onward! C’mere Tama. They exit, Ya-Ema and Ali giving a distrusting look. Beck isn’t making sense, obviously, and the casualness with wh she carries Tama makes Ali and Kat really nervous.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: What’s his deal?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: She calls him Ya-Ema but I think his real name is Alvin. We call him Sauron. THE VENUE, BECKY’S DRESSING ROOM - THAT SAME MOMENT 5 Becky has Tama down in a chair and is at the mirror, look at herself with total satisfaction. Not a ‘what am I doin messed up on drugs while I have my baby?’ moment. Becky h wipes and makes messier-therefor-cooler her makeup. Glitt in her hair and everything now. Pretty rad look, actually Behind her, Ya-Ema’s helper DYMOKE has arranged the makin a seance with burning things, a pot of some witch-like origin, crystals, potions, things to drink. The works. Th origin of their beliefs are vague. Voodoo? Zulu? Flim fla  8. Becky sits and we have a pause, a lull for an eternal thr seconds. Ya-Ema holds out a hand to her.

dialogues.speaker: YA-EMA
dialogues.text: The item? Becky produces a photograph and an item of jewelry. Ya-Em hands them to Dymoke who places them at the center of the ceremonial table. This shit is weird. Dymoke rubs some so of powder on the objects and lights candles around them.

dialogues.speaker: DYMOKE
dialogues.text: We purge the essence of invasive forces from this place. Becky closes her eyes and takes Ya-Ema’s hand. She buys whatever this is 110%. She is focused and at peace. This peace is ruined by a knock/enter which stirs her and in w DANNY and a young pretty girl named TIFFANY.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: What’s she DOING here, can’t you see this is a fucking religious ceremony and you have to respect that? Danny doesn’t respect or buy Ya-Ema at all. He ignores hi

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Good show tonight.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: You're a liar. You didn’t see it.

dialogues.speaker: TIFFANY
dialogues.text: Don’t call people liars, Becky, unless you know they're lying.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry was anybody speaking to you Lil’ Miss Tiff-a-knee? Tiffany. Tiffany! I can’t believe you're raising our daughter around a woman named Tiffany. Tiff-ant the pissant.

dialogues.speaker: TIFFANY
dialogues.text: You’re an angel.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: True. It’s all true! (sticks tongue out, makes a thhhhhp noise)

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Can you excuse us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse us, Tiff. Tiffany looks at the seance table. She picks up the photograph and holds it: it is of her.

dialogues.speaker: TIFFANY
dialogues.text: The fuck...where did you get these?

dialogues.speaker: DYMOKE
dialogues.text: Ya-Ema requested items to envision the purity of people whose auras we must to investigate before Mistress Becky allows them around the child.

dialogues.speaker: TIFFANY
dialogues.text: (to Danny) Is this for real?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (hemming and hawing) ...it’s important that she feel safe when Tama is with us. That’s all.

dialogues.speaker: TIFFANY
dialogues.text: So you put a curse on me?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: We didn’t curse you yet and we probably won't unless Ya-Ema sees something in the smoke that you he doesn’t like.

dialogues.speaker: TIFFANY
dialogues.text: This is sick. You’re sick.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: That’s not helping. Just - can you just - give us a minute.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: (like a game show host) Gooooooccodbye Tiffaneeeeee! Tiffany exits swiftly, super angry, and Becky throws a fi full of snacks at the wall behind her.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Don’t be such a cunt, Beck.  10.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: C-U-N-T! Everyone’s accusing me! (to the tune of the Ramones “D-U-M-B / Everyone’s accusing me” from ‘Pinhead’) Danny goes to Tama, rubs her head lovingly and lowers by side. Becky is way zonked and getting tired. The rush of finishing a show and the rush of drugs after finishing a winds down. Ya-Ema and Dymoke sit like statues, watching, quietly. Ya-Ema nods once. This is all you can get from him.

dialogues.speaker: DYMOKE
dialogues.text: We must resume the ritual.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Yeah we must so what can we do ya for, Dan-O?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I wanted you to see her. It shouldn’t be this difficult.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Why would I want to see Tiffany? Yuck! (barfing noises)

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: See your child. Unless you’d rather walk out on her, too. In which case- Becky bumbles to Tama. Danny lifts her before Becky arriv

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How can you let yourself be like this around her?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: (real loopy) Listen man I’m working and you'd said Tuesday not Friday which so how am I supposed to keep track if you keep changing your mind?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I thought you’d want to see her before going to Europe.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: You-rup I-rup we all rup for Eu-rope.  11. Becky is moving around, taking off accessories and pieces theatricality from the show. She doesn’t hold still at al she kicks off boots, de layers sweaty dirty clothing. Wit a minute of this quite serious conversation, she’s down t bra, necklaces, tight pants. Ya-Ema and Dymoke respect he rituals and face forward, completely unmoving from the direction of the table.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Oh. I forgot. You’re not going to Europe. Did you know that?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Of course I knew.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: You didn’t act like I was wrong when I said it.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: I was testing you there’s no European tour I’d know if there was.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: You would?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Because I’d have packed a bag which as you can see clearly I have not. Becky motions to an area on the floor that, to her total confusion and surprise, does contain a packed bag.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoooooa. What’s that!

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: You’re a mess.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: No you’re a mess. No you’re a mess.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Okay Becky. Instead of engaging, Becky has begun reapplying her makeu the mirror because with the show over, she is on her way the after party all night. Mari enters, nearly as buzzed as Becky but not quite. At least, she wears it better. Her girlfriend, LAUREN, is wi her and she looks incredibly stylish in a non rock n roll way. More slick. They are wrapped around one another.  12.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Danny boy. (singing) The pipes the pipes are calling. From glenn to glenn and down the mountain siiiiiide.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Mari. You seem...well. He is wryly joking because she is all fucked up too. But outfit (changed from the show, ready to party) and genera demeanor are sharper and more hip than messy Becky.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: We ready to rock? Becky has put on a ‘clean’ top (stained/tattered) and is doing something to her hair which could be called abuse.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Laurie baby! We just finished rocking. Rocking and a rolling! The only problem is I did not get to visit the other place with Ya-Ema because ol’ Dan-O came in and interrupted my spiritual journey it was postponed so we've still got that to tend to because you know that I’m not myself if I don’t get a moment to visit other realities where the fuck is my lighter. Danny hurts to see this. He holds Tama close. Becky is ba present on this plane of reality right now.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (to Mari) Why would you let her do this?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Not the fuckin’ baby sitter, mate.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Why? Why? B-E-C-K-Whyyyy? Because I gotta!

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Hey man don’t discriminate against whatever gives people spiritual balance. That’s like f-f-fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Hello exactly!  13. Becky hi-fives Dymoke. Ya-Ema leaves her hanging for a se before giving a reluctant hi-five. Mari slides for a hi-f

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: You'll hate yourself forever if you miss these years with her.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Heavy shit, Dirtbag Danny.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Nobody calls me that anymore.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: (mock radio DJ voice) This is the Night Show with DJ Dirtbag Danny, playing all the dirty nasty rock you can only hear after dark!

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Becky. Becky? Mari goes to Becky to show off/examine something secret i Mari’s little drug carrying pouch. Danny, disgusted by th affront to responsibility, takes Tama and exits the dress room and we follow him. Lauren is ice cold when he looks her for some support or validation. She shrugs, blankly. THE VENUE, CORRIDOR —- CONTINUOUS 6 Danny walks down the corridor looking for Tiffany. The do to Ali’s dressing room is open. He sticks his head in. Ali is doing her balanced post show ritual: washing her f with scrub, drinking a warm herbal tea and other treatmen for a quality exhausting life. She too has changed from h show outfit to something more sloppy and casual, but stil very cool and stylish. The forms are signed and neatly ba in their folder, which Kat is exiting with as Danny lands

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Hey. THE VENUE, ALI’‘S DRESSING ROOM - CONTINUOUS 7 Danny lingers in the door.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: You seen Tiffany?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Just you, Danny boy.  14. Danny steps in, carrying stress and negativity with his b

dialogues.speaker: ALI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t come around and see her like this.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What choice do I have? I’m the loser who always crawls back.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Twice she fired me from this tour and forgot about it the next morning. We all crawl back.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: How much does she pay the shaman?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: We’re not sure. In all likelihood, the answer would upset you and me both.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: How’s business?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Euro tour’s cancelled. But I guess you already knew that. They’re opening the vaults for an EP or something.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: She’s gonna fuck this up for all of us. It doesn’t end well.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Don’t be so negative, dude. What’s it about? You need cash?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Tama needs more than I can give. Becky has to take responsibility. They share a brief, quiet moment. Ali looks at Tama, who really does love. Her hand reaches out slowly.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: May I? Danny offers Tama to Ali, the opposite of protecting her around Becky.  15.

dialogues.speaker: ALI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Howard might cancel the dates we’re holding for the new record. He knows we're not ready.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: It means I hope you’ve got a plan B to put this one in private school.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: She in breech? Do I need to talk to somebody?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Our lawyer's got it all sorted. I dunno. No one’s really expecting much of her at this point. Ali sits down with Tama. Weary, from the show and cradles Tama’s head, lovingly. Danny gets close, and the two of t holding Tama, it’s almost like a portrait of an actual functional family. Ali catches Danny looking at her and thinking this very thought. Her look lets on a lot: before Becky, Ali and Da were involved. There’s a linger here. Ali breaks away.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: She handed me my walking papers and seven months later hands me Tama. Ever since then my life’s been a nightmare. In some ways.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Um, wow. Heavy, man. My fault. I thought you two would be a match made in heaven.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Don’t listen to me. I shouldn't be here.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: DJ Dirtbag Danny used to roll hard.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Don’t desire being a damn dirtbag come forty. I’m putting down roots for my daughter. I bought WABK for her future.  16.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: They're opening the vaults for an EP or something. Sorry, did I say that already? Because you know, a contract is a contract?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: ‘Lies’ is deeply underrated.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: You used to love her. Becky enters, forcefully. It’s obvious that in the interv she took another hit of something strong and unnecessary repair her lagging energy. She isn’t doing so well with standing up straight and is giddy, light headed and daffy She looks at Tama like Tama is the devil.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: I want her out of here. Danny sort of blocks her from getting to Tama.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey get the fuck outta my way.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Christ Beck, don’t talk like that. What’s got into you?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: She has to go. She has to go now.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: You can’t be serious. Dymoke and Ya-Ema enter, obviously having had to chase Be

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: We saw it in the smoke. ‘The child will be your downfall.’ Tell them, Ya- Ema. TELL THEM WHAT YOU SAW!! She is shrieking. Ya-Ema looks afraid, like he has lost control of Becky. He looks at Danny with calm eyes.

dialogues.speaker: YA-EMA
dialogues.text: I did not decree this.  17.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: You did you did you did you did! You saw a prophecy and when we were in the Other Place you told me that the child will be my downfall so we've got a lit stick a’ dyn-O-MITE that needs tossing out the tank.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: This is your child you're talking about. Please. Be reasonable. Becky grabs for Tama and Danny sees the fear and insanity her eyes. It’s nutty. He protects Tama.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can we take a minute? Ya-Emu, calm her down somehow? Do whatever it is you do. Ya-Ema and Dymoke come to Becky, apprehensive, but it’s c she trusts them. They hold her head. She closes her eyes falls back into their arms. They carry her to the couch a lay her down. There’s silence, and people wonder if the w is over. Calm for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: DYMOKE
dialogues.text: Mistress Becky! Look at my Ting. Becky looks at his amulet and then breaths deep and slowl

dialogues.speaker: DYMOKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell us what you see.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: I see The Void of Eternity.

dialogues.speaker: YA-EMA
dialogues.text: (chanting) Ammmmmm nahhhhhhh. Ammmmmm nahhhhhbhh. Becky opens her eyes and sits up. It’s insane: like she i different person. Still messed up but fear of Tama is gon

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: (to Tama) Hello baby. Mommy missed you. Danny looks at Becky like she is dangerous. He doesn’t kn how to proceed dealing with her right now. He tries norma  18.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Ali said you're doing an EP instead of a full record.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Yeah who knows I mean it might not even happen. Like it probably won't work out or anything even though some of the ‘92 sessions we dug up are powerful and maybe a track or two from earlier that I’d forgotten. Becky pulls Ali down into her lap. Her energy is all over place and totally toxic to Danny and Ali. Ya-Ema and Dymo are in a trance, as if trying to control Becky’s mind. Enter HOWARD GOODMAN, the manager, (50). His life is defi by trying to stay afloat and stay one step ahead.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Howard. How-ard you tonight? Good show huh?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: They love you. And I love that they love you. Danny. What’s happening?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Holding it together. You wouldn’t understand. Sarcasm. They both sort of nod like, yeah, right, ha ha.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Becky, Zelda is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Ah fuck it I forgot. What’s that bitch want? Mari and Lauren enter.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Easy now.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Stuck up holier than thou too good for it all wench.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Why don’t you tell us how you really feel?  19.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Yeah whatever what does she want?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Express regards. Cheer. Celebratory remarks? She said you were great tonight.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Did she come only with fucking obvious things I already know or what of course I was great I’m always great so don’t be late.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I believe I saw her with an olive branch. Would I lead you astray?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: (rolling her eyes) Nooooo Howarrrrd you wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Do it for me. She’s not lying. You were great tonight. Becky looks to Ya-Ema and Dymoke for consultation.

dialogues.speaker: DYMOKE
dialogues.text: She brings negativity.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: You see! What is Zelda E. Zekial coming and doing here anyways coming backstage at our show when where I am spending qual-ah-tee time with my family and demand an audience?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Chill out with that, okay girl? Zelda's alright.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Okay FINE I’ve decided to go. Where is she Howard, and while we’re on the topic can you please tell me are we doing those recordings at R-Trax like last time because I can’t get a straight answer on the matter. Becky prances about triumphantly when saying this last pa The room is cramped: Ali, Mari, Lauren, Becky, Danny, Tam Howard.  20. All obstacles for Becky to shimmy around and out of the r Everybody follows her like the Pied Piper except Ya-Ema a Dymoke, who we leave behind for now.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Of course. Anything you need. Becky throws her arm around Howard as they exit the room. THE VENUE, CORRIDOR —- CONTINUOUS 8

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: That’s because you understand me don’t you! I can’t count on anybody cah-rist what kind of world is this where we don’t even have the straight information about whether or not we are like making an album nobody is helping me write or some E fucking P with just I don’t know, an acoustic guitar? Can somebody please help Dear Howard and give me an answer and please make it an honest one!

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Let’s say hello to Zelda and I’11 confirm this while you’re with her. She's excited to see everybody.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: We're all going? Why didn’t you say so! I don’t wanna do it alone. To me, my X-Women! Becky leads Mari (sort of digging this) and Ali (dying inside) down the corridor. Lauren follows. Howard stops a ways back with Danny. Stay with them as the ladies walk a

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: To your right then on the left.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: To the right and to the left and to the right and to the left... Howard, Danny and Tama. Quiet after a whirlwind. Deep bre

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I wish I had your patience.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I’m a communicator. I communicate. How’s she doing?  21. He lovingly pats Tama.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Good. She’s good.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: How're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: She turned her back and walked away ninety nine times. I need an even hundred. You ever have a bad habit you just can’t quit?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: No. But hey: you know who does? They both laugh. A sad, tender moment between the men who suffer for Becky. Howard’s eyes are full of empathy.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anything I can do?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Help her. That’1ll help me. Howard looks down the hall at where Zelda’s room is.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I’m trying. I’m always trying.

dialogues.speaker: THE VENUE, GREEN ROOM
dialogues.text: Becky, Ali and Mari burst into a room with snacks and whatnot. In it is ZELDA E. ZEKIAL, smoking, looking cool fashionable. She faces down the three amigos in the door (Lauren hangs back just a little). Becky enters dancing, annoyingly singing a song. Mari claps for the beat. Zelda is in with the cool crowd, the art crowd. (Like Kat Bush/St. Vincent/PJ Harvey.) Her hair is outrageous and exciting and her makeup is glam. Becky resents her deeply

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: (clapping) Miss Ezekial don’t get no bones... Ezekial don’t got no tones... And here’s the word of the lord. Well the finger bones connected to the hand bone (middle fingers up, Mari joins in singing now) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The hand bone’s connected to the fuck bone The fuck bone’s connected to the butt bone. (Becky aggressively rubs her butt on and around Zelda's head/shoulders. ) And that’s the turd of the lord. Zelda brushes Becky’s butt away and fixes her awesome hai

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: Great show, Beck.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Easy for you to say from the comfort of that chair. Zelda looks down, bummed that this is going to be one of “those” Becky conversations.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: Ladies. Brilliant work. Ali gives Zelda a friendly hug/air kiss hello. Mari gives a much more intimate kiss. They were briefly a thing.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Hey there babe.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Zee Zee. Sweetie. This is Lauren, my love.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: You're a beauty.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: C’mon. Mari’s told me all about you.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: I CAN JUST GO if you all want some alone time.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Hey, chill.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: I agree let’s all of us just take it down a notch and take stock of the situation. Becky sits, mockingly overly proper and business like.  23.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Zelda darling what to do we owe the pleasure of your visitation?

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: You guys are killers. The new shit for myself. Zelda is cool as a cucumber and cold as ice. Drags her cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: What’d ya think?

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: I’m green with envy.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Thanks, doll. Becky jumps up and starts rummaging around the snack area lightly stuffing her face.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: Howard said that you guys are almost wrapping this one up--

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Yeah I don’t know. Whatever. I’m not really feeling the stage life right now, ya get me? I dunno why do you ask.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: (eyes at Mari and Ali) I've got a string of dates coming up. Want to see if guys would be interested in joining. Pregnant pause. Becky freezes. Mari and Ali brace for imp

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Um I dunno Z-grade. What, you mean like opening act for you? Hardly makes sense don’t ya think? What is this, six years ago? Oh wait if it was six years ago you’d be opening for M. E. me and you’de be trying to run off with this one. Points to Mari. No shame. Becky is buzzing about like a nervous bird, touching everything and moving things aroun  24.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: When are the dates?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: What are the dates? Becky pauses. She nearly chokes on rage and sadness. She takes a short, Becky-sized moment to regain herself.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How about a simple ‘no thanks’ and also thanks for the gesture of coming here to personally bitch slap us in all our faces. Nah. We do rock music to rock people and didn’t I hear that on your last record didn’t even have any guitars?? (mock snoring noises) Zelda stands, graceful and elegant, and takes a tiny bird like bite of the snacks Becky has made a mess of.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: End of the winter. March ish.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Don’t fuckin’ talk to her. Don’t even look at her. Here’s an idea. How about you march-ish right out of the room into your limousine and take that fuckin’ offer with you? We need a break, not a tour. I mean, we just finished this one like an hour ago so who'se interested in another tour not me that’s who.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: You brought me on my first tour, Beck, and I'll never forget it. I’m not your enemy. I never was despite what you thought happened at that festival thing. You gonna make me beg to get you to bury the hatchet?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Uh your music used to be awesome and now it sucks so I don’t want to tour with you and now you’ve come to bury me. I speak for everybody when I say that there is zero interest in retreading the past which includes your fabled tour. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m trying to move for-ward here, not backwards and that means I don’t wanna slip down your bill. Don’t you have like the next generation of pansy art rock babes dying to share your light so why don’t you ask one a’ them. My answer is no and where I go they go. Motioning to Ali and Mari, both mortified, silent and sad

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: I should go.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Stay PUH-lease I feel like we’re done here.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: (wry, smiling) You're one of a kind, Beck.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: You got that right, a true original, stick to your guns and your roots and never buy into the BS just the Becky Something, that’s what I always say. P- U-R-E spells Becky and PEE-YOU spells Zelda. Zelda cannot process the aggravation, having come here to something nice and have it thrown back at her so angrily. Howard appears with an optimistic smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: So! Do we have a deal?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Howard how could you? I trusted you and you set me up!

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I thought you might feel this way but hear us out.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: It’s not what you’re thinking. It’s not clubs. It’s theaters. An intimate--

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: BORING. Pass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m sorry that---

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Oh my god if you aren’t going to leave I will. I have an interrupted journey to complete and by the way you’re all being incredibly rude to Ya-Ema and the spiritual calm he requires. (to Howard) I am not done with you. You’re in big trouble. Becky storms out. The room takes a moment to catch it’s breath. Don’t shit talk the hand that feeds you. Ali looks back at the door where Becky exited. Zelda is perceptive, deceptively so. Sly, eyes narrowing.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: “Having fun in Beckytown.”

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Whatever could you mean?

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: Say it. Cut the “B.S.”

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: There’s nothing. Ali wants to stay. Mari takes comfort in Lauren’s hands. Howard looks a little disappointed, but not really.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: Who’se Ya-Ema?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Sauron, the all seeing guru. Mari and Lauren smile. They are fascinated by Becky’s wei relationship with Ya-Ema.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: I’ll go.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: I...think that might be for the best?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry. Worth a shot, though? Maybe we take another swing when she’s not so...so...I can’t find the word.  27.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: Door’s open and I’m all ears. You used to pack places twice this size. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Canceling tours twice at the last minute has untested side effects.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t know.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: It’ll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: And if it isn’t?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: It’ll be fine. Zelda studies them. She is very sharp, respectable and impeccable. The scuzziness of this place, this level of f and revelry is years behind her. She looks at Mari and Al like abused children, afraid to speak out. Zelda puts on her very nice jacket and a stylish hat.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: If you change your mind--- Becky bursts back into the room like Kramer. She has had another hit of whatever she is on and is all wired up and has Tama with her. Danny and Tiffany trail behind, panick Ya-Ema and Dymoke are there as well.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Holy smoking crap you’re still here? Zelda has left zee building. Take a hint! The Legend of Zelda A Stink to the Ass must come to an E-N-D if you please.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: I’m leaving. Don’t overreact.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: I hardly think I’m overreacting just normal react. She is wired, unwell, fraying at all edges. Like a bee, buzzing around and you couldn’t swat her if you tried.  28.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean, Zelda, baby, like excuse me for being so fuckin’ naive but how dare you invade this space?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: It was entirely my idea. Don’t blame her. Becky motions to Ya-Ema and Dymoke, cleansing the air wit some sort of burning reed, purifying the room for her.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: I’m leaving. Peel it the fuck down. Zelda makes for the exit, waving away Ya-Ema’s smoke. She Mari exchange an intimate look. A little silent side stor plays out with Zelda saying bye to Mari, Ali and Howard w Danny and Becky engage on the other side of the room.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Let me take her.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: What no. Get away from me? Dymoke needs to purify her weren’t you listening?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t be holding her in the state you’re in.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: What state is that Dan-O? The state of rage or the state of New York I don’t know where I am anymore you dumb fuckin’ clown, ha ha! She tries to hold Tama away and moves from Danny but trip and falls, forward, managing to spin quickly landing on h back, Tama up in the air. People rush in, freaking out. Becky is on the ground laug and holding Tama.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wheee that was a fun ride! You wanna go on another sky ride? With mommy! Danny grabs Tama. Becky refuses to let go but he gets her Tiffany puts her arm around Danny, protective.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dude chill I’ve got this.  29.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Get off her you fucking mess. There’s black rage in his eyes. He’s finished playing nic

dialogues.speaker: TIFFANY
dialogues.text: I think we need to leave.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Perhaps we should all retreat to our separate rooms for a bit? Becky starts rolling on the floor, slowly slinking up, ar and limbs clumsily draped over the furniture, like a crab She reaches for Tama and falls again, at Howard, Mari and Ali's feet. They all look afraid and upset.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: What you two suddenly have nothing to say? Just watching the show. Ha ha you're doing a better job of it than playing in it that’s for sure. Oh look at me running my mouth but let’s not say anything we might regret later. Hey maybe if you run you can catch up with Zel-duhhh. She can have you. She's easy and boring and no fun isn’t that what you want? Mari has been hurting watching this. She and Ali look dow Becky with lumps in their throats. This pains them, a lot

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Don’t. Not now. Not with us.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Don’t what? Be awesome and show people a G-O-O-D time?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Cone on. Please. Becky stumbles trying to grab Tama. Ya-Ema holds her up.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Tough job but somebody's gotta do it and I gotta get out of here. I gotta go to Becky’s room. It stinks of Zelda shit. So I bid you adeiu and hibbida hibbida that’s all folks!  10 11 30. She snatches Tama from a shocked Danny and then pushes hi park bench style, over a chair and he falls to the ground while she scurries off. This is all happening so fast. She exits. The room is empty of aggression. Just silent, shocked faces of people who want so badly to care about h Ya-Ema and Tiffany help Danny up. Seconds pass. It’s very few seconds but after what’s just happened, it feels like a lot. Time stands still, dissolv allude to the collapsing of real time and we see, in slow motion, the devastation wrought by Becky. Hurt feelings, smashed stuff. Seconds pass like hours in silence.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: I just want to play music in a band. It breaks the tension. People smile and just as there is laughter again, the crying of Tama off in the distance se them all on high alert. Danny springs into action. THE VENUE, CORRIDOR —- CONTINUOUS 10 Follow Danny running like mad. Behind him, Ali and Mari, Lauren, Howard, Tiffany, Ya-Ema and Dymoke. Danny knocks chair that is in his way. Kat comes back out of the hallw when she hears the commotion and joins. Follow Danny into Becky’s dressing room, his perspective, reveal: THE VENUE, BECKY’S DRESSING ROOM - CONTINUOUS 11 Becky is on the ground, vomit in front of her face and on mouth. Bloody forehead. Tama is on the floor crying, screaming. It’s not clear exactly what happened and it doesn’t matte Danny holds Tama close (Tama is crying: wailing) as Ali a Mari drop to their knees, right in the vomit, prop Becky start shaking her, throwing water on her. Her eyes flutte Fingers into Becky’s throat. Nothing happens. Becky is li Looks are quickly exchanged. Howard runs in, says nothing Mari and Ali are breaking out in sweat. Dymoke is quickly mixing some potion in a thistle and rubs it on Becky’s ne Ya-Ema begins to chant, slowly, deep, otherworldly.

dialogues.speaker: YA-EMA
dialogues.text: Innnn-connn-immmm Tama is still crying and crying.  31. Ali rips off her vomit covered shirt and props it under Becky’s head, grabs a coke mirror and puts it under her n to see if she is breathing. Dymoke’s hands are in the way spreading his elixir on her chest.

dialogues.speaker: YA-EMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Innnn-connn-immmm Tama is still crying and crying and crying. Becky's eyes flutter faster. She vomits some more onto Al hands and struggles to open her eyes, to breath, and does even try to hold her head up.

dialogues.speaker: YA-EMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (chanting) Innnn-connn-immmm

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Come back Becky. Don’t do this again. Becky locks eyes with everybody around her, cradled on th floor like an invalid covered in puke and blood. Silence. Pausing. Breathing that rises and falls. Anxiety everywhe

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: (garbled, mouth full of puke and mucus) We go way beyond. Tama’s crying echoes through all of this and it’s awful. END OF ACT ONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAINY VHS HOME MOVIE FOOTAGE: Becky/Mari/Ali. Full of positivity, excitement, happiness. The contrast of what w just saw is shocking. They are holding framed platinum records for their second album BABY I’M SICK.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: We could get at least a hundred bucks for these.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: The first and only girl rock band to sell this many records. I'd like to say!

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Two hundred! Nah I'll keep it. First and last. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The well of inspiration has run-a dry! Never gonna make a record this good again. Good as gold! They all keep laughing. Becky clumsily drops the framed record, breaking the glass. She loses it, starts laughing hysterically. Mari and Ali follow.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh shit! We’re never gonna make a record this good again.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Howard! We need a new one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Golden, yellowish brown lights buzz bask this past it’s p studio in a ancient haze of wood and history. The place i laden with signs of the amount of time Becky has spent he in the sprawling, open ended eight months of recording th have gone poorly. Tapestries hang over crystals and other items from Ya-Ema shitty candles, no fewer than twenty packed ash trays. Th place is capital D Dingy and Becky the decrepit centerpie Becky is wearing scarves and a threadbare t shirt with on sleeve nearly gone tucked into skin tight pants. She’d lo iconically cool if she wasn’t so tragic. Her messy ponyta is a caked with grease, a heart barrette in her hair, her skin is bad and she feels 1,000% like a goddess. She poorly makes feeble attempts to strum an acoustic gui and sing a weak sounding half finished song. Warbling, ba making notes and words find one another. (the song is called Pulled Down and has been written by Alicia Bognanno/aka Bully)

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: You rotted away Left to your own mistakes I never wanted to be the crutch for you I’m falling behind With every word you break I meant to try and piece it back for you And I’m back to the same shit I was Drowning in mud If I’m gonna be pulled down I’m taking you with  13 33. The whole scene is rocky as we pan to the side and see Ma and Ali. They are behind glass in the booth with Howard a the distanced hush shows off the tension.

dialogues.speaker: RECORDING STUDIO MIXING BOOTH 13
dialogues.text: Silently, Ali, Mari and Howard watch Becky, smoke a cigar or two of their own and recognize how dead end this feels They are holding one another in a protective, loving embr KEITH the engineer mutes her and though Becky still plays half assed, they turn so she cannot see and quietly talk, like Bowman and Poole keeping secrets from HAL9000 in 200

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I finally understand why you begged me to stop checking in.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Fuckin’ bummer. Told you you shouldn’ta come back.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I had to see for myself who was occupying this studio I stopped paying for. Did they not give you the memo?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Becky decided to pay for it. Shoulda told you. But didn’t want to. Out of respect, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Isn’t that nice of her. I have this room booked for my new group but it’s not yet vacated.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: So that’s why you came back.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Did they not tell you you had to leave?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: They did.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: And what did they say?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: I'd rather not repeat it.  34.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: If this is the best she has to show after nine months I’m very screwed.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: To be fair, it’s nine next week so we still have time to pray for a third trimester disaster.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: I know you’re out on a limb big time for us with on this record.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Laid off staff to cover overages? Mortgage on my beach house? I’m not on a limb, I’m lying on the ground next to the damn tree.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: I didn’t know that. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Releasing their new album this year would help cover your mess. Interrupted by Becky, pounding on the window looking mean nasty. Throughout, her voice is muted. Sound proofing.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: What is this. Talk and tea time? Are we doing a session or a goddamn book club jesus christ am I the only one here who cares about the work we’re doing? Mari looks right at her but speaks under her breath.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: This is the first day in two weeks she stayed for longer than an hour.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: And also she came at two. (Howard checks his watch) A.M. We've been here. She’s in a self proclaimed groove. Howard notices how tired and bleary eyed they are and the massive amount of coffee cups, tea pots and drugs. Becky storms into the booth, fuming, nostrils flaring and dripping snot and moisture. Mari and Ali finally detach.  35.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Show a’ hands, who is committed to greatness and will do whatever it takes to achieve greatness and show of hands who is lazy and doesn’t care about this music that we are recording? (she raises her hand with vigor) That’s one for greatness. Anyone else? Keith sheepishly raises his hand.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: THANK you Keith, nice to know someone is on my side, the winning side and we all know who writes history. You all can go home and take a nap or something now that your level of dedication is exposed. Right Howard? Did you come to check up on your prized project? Thank you for giving us space lately but I gotta tell you I’m sorry but things are going terribly, at best. Speechless reactions. Becky is super messed up, sweating, barely coherent, blind to it all. All four just stare at A quiet pause as we zero in on Becky: see and feel with q dignity the lack of understanding behind her bright blue eyes, the smoke screen of delusion which she hides behind Slow motion. Linger...there is nothing but truth and hone on her tired face. She believes every word she says and w we see Mari, Ali, Howard and Keith, the extent of pity an sadness for Becky transmits off them. It’s a small moment that becomes a big moment without announcing itself.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: There’s a solution to this. I need to figure out what it is. Let’s take a step back and think for a second.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: That is a graaaand idea. Why can’t you two be team players like Howard!

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Give it a rest lady. The show's exhausting and I’ve seen it too many times to stick for the finale.  36.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Sorry what. What did you say.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: She said---

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Oh I heard her but I just wanna make sure I heard it correct-lee. Ali darling. Care to take it one more time from the top with feeling see vous play?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Look at yourself.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Easy now. Becky does just that in the glass window reflection and i obvious she loves what she sees. She blows herself a kiss

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Would Becky Something wither and die if she interacted on an adult level?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Let’s not. Let’s be calm. Let’s withdraw to somewhere neutral place and talk compromises.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: BORING. Bore snore. Ali grabs a coat, brushes past Becky with a final icy dag stare. Howard is chin-in-palm, in agony, losing everythin because he isn’t thinking fast enough.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: WELL the least you could make some sort of grand final statement right?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: I took care of this band while you took care of yourself. I never asked to be thanked. I never wanted the gloss. That was your thing. You plucked me into it. So why should I explain myself when you’re just going to remember your version. She kisses her fingers and makes a ‘peace’ sign.  14 15 37. Ali gives the briefest pause on her exit, to Howard, then Mari, not expecting her to follow, but to say with her ey ‘that’s that.’ Mari half opens her mouth like she is goin say something but doesn’t because Ali is already gone.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: It’s just as Ya-Ema prophesized! Ha ha, what a fitting moment just when I was seriously doubting your commitment. I mean it’s been a rotten year stuck carrying this mongoloid to term but today was the final straw and I knew it when I walked in the d-o-o- r. I felt the fetid stink in the elevator. Biggggg whoop. Want to see how quickly we bounce back? Watch me. I’m Ali now.

dialogues.speaker: RECORDING STUDIO
dialogues.text: She storms back into the studio and bangs on the drums wi no rhythm. It’s a cacophonous mess and just dreadful nois and Becky is screaming over the banging. It’s godawful an she grabs her guitar, strums with one hand and smashes a cymbal with the other and screeches into a mic.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: (voice of Old Prospector) Keith hit record we’ve struck gold!

dialogues.speaker: RECORDING STUDIO MIXING BOOTH 15
dialogues.text: Howard is mortified about the collapse of a profitable ac Mari chokes back lumps of emotion because she is tethered this sinking ship. Move in tight on her face as Becky’s n becomes even worse. It’s all happening for Mari now. Ali gone. This is rock bottom.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: I'm so fucked. The next band’s going to show up any minute. You shoulda told me you were still here. I need time to think.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Hey don’t just leave me here--- (his talking fades out) Follow Mari out into the hallway and then the ladies room  16 17 18 38.

dialogues.speaker: RECORDING STUDIO, LADIES ROOM
dialogues.text: It’s grim and dirty because only the band uses it. Mari t a small hit of her own drugs, a few pills, and pauses, no the mirror, just by the sink area. It’s all crashing down This is ending and she knows it more than she feared. Time gets wobbly. Slow motion/hazy dissolves. Stay with M and feel her studying the years of her life which have be invested in this band. She is stoned and lapses into a me tunnel. Sounds that aren’t there can be heard, echoing fr the back of her memory. It’s woozy.

dialogues.speaker: RECORDING STUDIO HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Mari comes out into the hallway. Something is off. The li are different than before and all seems quiet. Not a soun all. Mari seems confused. Then she hears girlish chatting echoing down the hall, hollow and chipper. She follows it and drifts back into the mixing room.

dialogues.speaker: RECORDING STUDIO MIXING BOOTH
dialogues.text: An unexplained element: a trio of younger, raw girls.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Uh--- This girls are all younger than 25. The next generation. are THE AKERGIRLS: DOTTIE 0.Z., CRASSY CASSIE and ROXIE ROTTEN. They are all cool as anything and stripped down somehow stylish even beyond what Becky and co. could ever imagine. Greasy hair, boys clothes, either no makeup at a or a ton and it’s really styled. They run the gamut. Dott has pink hair. Roxie washes hers once a month. Cassie’s i styled and really well cut, shaggy, simple.

dialogues.speaker: DOTTIE
dialogues.text: Marielle Hell. Fuckin’ fuck what an honor. The Akergirls bow, take hands like the witches they are a surround Mari, who is slow and perplexed. After they brea off, Dottie and Roxie stay holding hands, embracing.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Mari’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: DOTTIE
dialogues.text: We’re booked. I mean, we were booked here. Like, Howard said--  39.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: I heard. It’s just a whole nightmare right now. She looks through the glass: in the studio Becky is bangi on silly instruments, plastic toys: lit up and glazed dow

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Are you kidding, we only want this place because you guys record here.

dialogues.speaker: ROXIE
dialogues.text: Shameful to say it’s an honor to be bumped by Something She. Like, the top. I’m rambling. Sorry, nerves!

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: It’s alright. But uh, this is a terrible time. We’re down a woman and, um, this is all going, like, the worst it’s ever gone. She looks around. Keith seems to be managing the schedule

dialogues.speaker: MARI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Keith, where’s Howard?

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Back office. Might wanna check on him. He doesn’t look good and I think he’s dry heaving.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: See, exactly. Not to get too deep but shit’s like, falling apart big time now so maybe actually we move out and you girlies take over. She’s losing them. The Akergirls are transfixed, watching Becky, somehow having pulled it together and singing a so with acoustic guitar. All watch for a moment and just briefly, through the POV the Akergirls, you see the attraction to Becky: she is brilliant and powerful. The song is ‘Because You’re Young Cock Sparrer.  40.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Because you're young, you're torn between A world of hate and a world of dreams So much to lose, so much to gain So much to fight for, so much to change You don't look back, you don't look down You gotta turn everything around You live your life like a loaded gun Because you're young Stop talking back, get off the phone You're late again, you missed the last bus home This ain't the way you want to live I know something's got to give (song continues over the next bit of dialogue)

dialogues.speaker: ROXIE
dialogues.text: Fuck man. She’s the queen.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t let her hear you say that. Does she already know you’re here?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Unclear.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: So I don’t know if she’s going to be into that. The behavior around here is shall we say erratic lately. Erratic on a good day.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: On a bad day?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: They’re all bad days nowadays. Howard enters, pale and chomping antacid tablets. He trie not to let anybody see: he wants to make a solution happe

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Seems we've got a logjam!

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: I can see that.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: We're all family here, right? Business family. One big happy business family.  41.

dialogues.speaker: DOTTIE
dialogues.text: If there’s some probl--

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Nonsense. No problem at all! Everything's fine. We record your album. Release it. Everything will work out. Easy as pie. Becky will understand. Roxie Rotten is still just watching Becky, who now looks an animal at the zoo aware of being watched. Everybody freezes because her playing stops. The lioness sees.

dialogues.speaker: DOTTIE
dialogues.text: I’d say she knows we’re here now. Keith subtly turns off the recording. The room freezes as people watch Becky slowly make the realization that she h an audience. She stares them all down. One by one. Direct contact. She speaks softly. Nobody can hear the words. He face is a mystery. No screaming, no smiling, just talking motioning to her instruments and pointing directly at Mar It’s almost dead silent.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Here she comes. Becky stands up slowly in continued agonizing silence and makes her way to the booth. She enters and faces this mas crowd: Keith, Howard, Mari, Cassie, Dottie, Roxie. There’ unfamiliar look on her face, one Becky Something doesn’t display very often. Absolute confusion and vulnerability. a rare moment, she is quiet. Nothing exits her mouth save tiny, nervous gasps of air. Mari shakes her head slightly, making sure to convey that doesn’t know what’s going on and had nothing to do with i

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are these bitches?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: The Akergirls. Did I not send you their seven inch? You’re gonna love them. You’1l love them. I’ve, yeah, I’ve signed them and now they-

dialogues.speaker: ROXIE
dialogues.text: We're not interrupting. No disrespect Miss, uh Something.

dialogues.speaker: DOTTIE
dialogues.text: Huge fans.  42. They all do the circle thing around Becky who is still sl

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: As thrilling as it is to see your passionate commitment, I was counting on the studio being free by now. Perhaps that’s my mistake. I haven't exactly been around.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: You cut us off. They tried to evict me. Why would you do that to us?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: A misunderstanding! I was giving you space and freedom without me breathing down your neck. I did what I had to do to tighten my belt. Can you blame me? Everyone is calm, assuming Becky will explode.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Okay. (to Mari) You know about this?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: We just showed. She had no idea. Becky still thinks. We don’t ever see her think. She usua acts without it. She takes it all in. Studies the girls.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Howard you fucking genius! Becky lapses happily into the Akergirls witchy circle and gently touches each of their faces.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are the odds. What are the ODDS that we’d find ourselves one apple short of a bushel and today of all days you unknowingly bring a solution to all the world’s problems. Who plays drums? Cassie raises her hand. Becky high fives it.  43.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The rest of you ready to jam? If I had to guess I'd say we’re fifteen maybe twenty minutes away from pure magic exploding into this room and silly old me lost a drummer on the way to grandmother’s house. Here I thought we'd have to scrap paper and go home but what should happen instead? Three witches come to my rescue. I mean just look at all of you. You’re all so beautiful. Stunning. The Akergirls blush at Becky’s kindness. Their idol! Beck touches all their hair and generally paws at them in a we grope-y way. Mari stands back, still and silent and loopy

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I’m Crassy Cassie. This is Dottie 0.2. And Roxie Rotten. She’s the life of the party and we’d be honored. Becky looks at Roxie and Dottie, celebrating this minor victory with a loving embrace. Becky studies it, dubious.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Cut the shit you’re making me feel a hundred years old but god damn I just feel a connection to you babes. Mari, you feel that? Mari is dead silent. Becky gives her a look, like: ‘are y in or out?’ And Mari knows it’s now or never.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Yeah Beck. I feel it. I’ve been out here feeling it for what feels like ever waiting for you to feel it.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: That’s what I’m talking about. Howard my Goodman. I’m ready to party and make a album and I have been sent angels to help me work the angels if you dig. What better way to introduce new blood into this turgid process than actual new blood. Becky bites Dottie on the neck, then bites Cassie.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s Bathory these bitches and learn a thing or two about what kids are feeling nowadays!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dottie and Cassie rub their necks. Becky actually bit the pretty damn hard.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Inward ho! Becky commands them into the studio area. Howard holds Ma and Becky back.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Keith, could you give us a minute? Keith exits.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: It looks like I’m saving your asshole and keeping this record right on schedule. Don’t worry about reimbursing me for the studio. It’s my treat.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I can’t afford eight more months. I’11l go bankrupt while you your “opus.” I’m on my last credit line and you’re on life number nine. These girls might be our salvation so it’d be swell if you didn’t torpedo them in the process of drowning.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: What is this, the scared straight express? Howard, you confuse torpedoing that I don’t know about with making an album which if you’1l excise me I’m quite eager to resume before my juices dry up again.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: (to Mari) Can you make her aware?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: What, do I need a translator? I got it. Loud and clear and as ear on the rear of a deer.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: We don’t have to do this. I mean, we just met them. We can take a day to regroup and call Ali--  19 45.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Who?I don’t know anybody by that name. Kind of a funny name isn’t it? ‘cept for a Muslim. Mari slaps Becky hard across the face. It’s silent again through the glass, the Akergirls notice and look in. Beck smiles like a psychotic. Howard continues to suffer silen

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mari. My love. You have my attention. Becky grabs Mari’s cheek and pinches it real hard and the smacks her on the butt at the same time, holding her clos

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I yours. Now is there something you wanted to say or was that merely a challenge to a duel.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: We don’t get another chance. If we fuck this up...sorry...if you fuck this up, it’s bye bye Something She. You dig?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: That’s the short of it. This is the first moment Becky doesn’t act like the Tazma Devil. Not Becky Something. Rebecca Adamczyk. Clear eyed.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: I’m going to finish this record. You have my word cross my heart and hope to die. She transforms for six seconds. Just as quick her eyes sw back: Becky Something returns and she skips into the stud with the Akergirls. Mari and Howard eye one another.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: One two, skip to my lou. Three four, skip to my door. Cows in the pasture, two by two/Lost my drummer what’1l I do?/I can get another as pretty as you/skip to my lou my darling. The Akergirls joined in and they all spin in a circle and Becky claps and leads a forced sing a long.  20 21 46.

dialogues.speaker: AKERGIRLS
dialogues.text: One two, skip to my lou.... (song continues in background)

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: It’s over. That’s that. I trusted you to be alone and you burned down the house. I’m so sorry. I've tried everything I can.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: I'll sort it. The lioness saw threatening cubs and forced ‘em into the pride rather than kill and eat them.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Can you handle her?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: It’s been almost seven years. What’s another seven days.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You’re one on one without Ali. I can’t help you. But I need you.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: I’ve got this, man.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You need your rocket fuel? Mari looks into the studio. The sing a long is over and t Akergirls bring in gear and Becky is ducking into a tent the corner, head down, and Mari knows what that means. It small/big moment on Mari, quiet, lingering.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: I’m need all the help I can get.

dialogues.speaker: RECORDING STUDIO
dialogues.text: Follow Mari in. She surveys the room. The Akergirls are unloading their bags of gear and tuning up a little and M sees the tapestry tent of Becky’s corner rustling. Mari joins. From afar the Akergirls see their feet under cloth and know the deal.  22 23 47. Show each of their faces, linger on the moment where they should know better and split. They each give one another subtle look.

dialogues.speaker: RECORDING STUDIO, BECKY'S LITTLE TENT 22
dialogues.text: Mari and Becky share a rare, quiet, intimate moment. We j back in here just after they’ve each had a little somethi and they're both buzzing and ready to pop. Becky is lighting a cigarette so the tent is lit via Zipp

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: You okay to do this?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Any second now. I’1l be fine. Mari gives Becky a look of extreme compassion and empathy

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (half normal) Give me a minute? Mari exits. We stay with Becky. In silence, for a moment, just a fleeting instant of adult awareness, that Becky understands that this is it. There’s no chance after this Becky is still, starting to slip into a daze when her dou fades away and she lights up like a fire cracker, slams h Zippo closed and storms out into the room.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Who's ready to do this shit! The Akergirls are stoked, in a tizzy that so quickly they have been welcomed to the inner sanctum. They are comfy. Shoes off (sneakers/no socks/very cool boots). Ready to w

dialogues.speaker: DOTTIE
dialogues.text: Anything you say.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Easy there. Easy easy. It’s not as simple as that. I’m comfortable in a leadership role but let’s slide into this hot spring.  48.

dialogues.speaker: ROXIE
dialogues.text: You want us to look at any sheets or just follow along.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Whoa you chicks read music? Fuck what a loser I am. There are some pieces we've been playing with but wouldn’t it make more sense for us to not rely on table scraps and make a feast as a new family instead?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: The album is written if that’s what you all mean.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Let’s hit it? We’re here for you. Whatever you need. Say the word.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Sure there is an album. There is some music but maybe they’re the problem? They’re cursed. Done to death. We need the new sound. Show me what the kids are doing. Akergirls just look at one another.

dialogues.speaker: DOTTIE
dialogues.text: What, just play?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Could I have made myself any clearer YES play. If we’re gonna be working together lets see what you've got. There’s tension. The Akergirls are afraid of being cast o and feel Becky’s judgement lurking. They strap on guitars bass), Cassie gets to the drums and they launch into a su sweet sounding melodic screechy early 90s Riot Grrrl insp song you could dance to, and indeed Becky does dance. Cas sings from behind the drums while Roxie and Dottie bring harmonies and backing on the chorus. It’s a fully collaborative song. (the song is called ‘Can't Wait’ and has been written by Anika Pyle.)

dialogues.speaker: AKERGIRLS
dialogues.text: Sweet tooth let it consume you You know you want to, you know you want to But baby I can’t wait around for you Tell me what you think you’re gonna do You know that I’m still in love with you But baby I can’t wait around for you I keep comin’ round but you’re not home I keep callin’ you won’t pick up the phone Am I such a fool to assume You think about me the way I think about you? You say it could change for just fade away But I feel the same have you fallen from grace? Yeah I’m here today but I can’t wait around Won’t wait around, can’t wait around for you So tell me what you think you’re gonna do You know that my love will always be true But baby I can’t wait around for you I can’t wait around, can’t wait around, I can’t wait around, I can’t wait for you Can’t wait around, I can’t wait, Baby I can’t wait for you Can’t wait around for you It’s great and runs like 90 seconds. Tight, fast and love Becky dances like a maniac, bobbing her head like a bobblehead. Mari is feeling it, tapping her leg.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: SMOKIN’! I love it. Love love love. Becky kisses Dottie, Roxie and Cassie in the weird way th are now used to. She is super affectionate and keeps her hands all over them while throwing her body on theirs.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is what its about my sisters. Who wrote it?

dialogues.speaker: DOTTIE
dialogues.text: (pointing one by one) Music, melody, lyrics.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: All of you? Brilliant. I’ve always longed for that connection but for some reason it never worked. I always did it all. By. Myself.  50. Akergirls look at Mari, who doesn’t disagree but it’s cle this credit hogging is a long time scab being picked at.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh sure Mari, your contributions have been helpful. But I’m talking about a ground up collaboration. I wish I could give it to you now but I know myself too well. Highway or her way. (thumbs at herself)

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: We're here to jam. Back you up. Anything.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: See, that’s what I need. Followers. Silent peons to worship at my feet. Mari is being beaten down silently. Becky is fully aware how much she is hurting her long time partner as she begi to prowl about the recording studio, moving like a spider preparing to launch into a messy soliloquy.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ladies ladies, what harmony you have found within one another! What spirit, shared, divided three ways. Alas. The rarest of things and not to be taken lightly. Capture it, my sisters, hold on to it and n-n-never release from the bond you share. Dottie and Roxie share a loving look. This all pains Mari Becky is showboating for the Akergirls and making her las ally feel terrible. During Becky’s speech, we are on Mari face as realization sets in.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Wise advise from a true original. Are you fucking kidding me? I hope you girlies don’t buy this bullshit. You seem smart. Smarter than me, dumb ol’ Mari. Grade A sucker, bought it hook line and sinker, fool me once, shame shame shame.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Um sorry but what?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Who better than the great Becky Something to dispel wisdom on the value of others? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MARI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who does more to express appreciation and dedication to those who support?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: I support. It’s not a two-a-day two way street darling.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: A dead end, darling.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Mari Mari Mari. Careful now. You’re gonna offend our guests.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Sorry sorry sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DOTTIE
dialogues.text: We can leave? We don’t wanna be flies on the wall. You sort this out alone.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Now you've done it. Alienating the acolytes. Vanquish the venerating. Exile the exuberant. This is a blessed thing! The next. Hold them close, we should. Not expel them from our midst.

dialogues.speaker: ROXIE
dialogues.text: It’s not expulsion---

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Quiet, all! This is important.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: It always is. And then it’s not. Mari is cool as ice, calm, chill, slick. Eyes half open, tired of this. She keeps it together and begins to pace about, gathering her things: packing a bass into a travel bag. Ali leaving and Becky’s togetherness monologue revea what Mari repressed. She’s pushed over the edge, finally.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Run away! Flee flee. Big bad bossy Becky makes maudlin Mari mope. Get the bullshit outta here. It belongs, it belongs on fuckin’ Mars! (in the style of Heavy Metal Parking Lot) Mark pauses her exit. Turns to Dottie, Cassie and Roxie.  52.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Enjoy it. It could be fun.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Now that’s the first logical thing I’ve heard all day! Mari exits with a final look back at Becky, who returns i not as Becky Something but as Rebecca Adamczyk.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Akergirls) All I’ve ever asked is respect and if you can’t get that in the work place then where can ya get it? You dig, right? Becky jumps on Cassie’s back, piggy back style and starts whacking her with a drumstick like a pony.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mush mush! Onward! Into the future. The Akergirls, Dottie Cassie and Roxie. The latest greatest girl rockers found right here under a wing of the eternal Becky Something.
