dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: I think she is.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: You know there’s like, a lot of shit around tonight. She cool with that?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Probably maybe. Hopefully.

dialogues.speaker: ROXIE
dialogues.text: People are getting real fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: We'll keep an eye on her.  44 45 101.

dialogues.speaker: THE VENUE, CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Becky looks at the doors. None have individual names, all just say ‘Talent’ so she peeks into some open ones and finally finds an ajar one and knocks on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tattooed girl and a few guys are inside: the girl is VI and she knows Becky, of course. Vivvy is equally cool, bu night and day from Becky. Dark hair, dark look.

dialogues.speaker: VIVVY
dialogues.text: Becky, whoa fuck you look awesome.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Hey Vivvy. Thought you'd be here.

dialogues.speaker: VIVVY
dialogues.text: Yeah for Howard. Right?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Right on. Becky looks past Vivvy into a room with people around a t with booze and drugs and joints and so on.

dialogues.speaker: VIVVY
dialogues.text: You wanna hang?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: (in a trance, almost) Uhhhhhh. No. No. I’m, um, I’m good. I’m just Zelda?

dialogues.speaker: VIVVY
dialogues.text: She's partying with us. Just stepped out. Wait for her. Becky looks at the drugs.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: No. I can’t. Just tell her I’m looking.

dialogues.speaker: VIVVY
dialogues.text: It’s great to see you. You doing the thing after?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Maybe. Probably not. My daughter’s here.  46 102.

dialogues.speaker: VIVVY
dialogues.text: How's Tama?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: She's good. She’s big. Almost seven.

dialogues.speaker: VIVVY
dialogues.text: I wanna see her.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Yeah sure. I’1l find you. Becky exits, starting to be disoriented. THE VENUE, CORRIDOR —- CONTINUOUS 46 She is losing her focus in the hallway which is full of c noises and the deja vu and the drugs are putting her on e She hasn't been around drugs since getting clean. There’s a circular disorienting moment where Becky gets l headed. She pauses and then resumes looking for Zelda. She opens Vivvy’s door again, confused.

dialogues.speaker: VIVVY
dialogues.text: Change your mind?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Oh, uh no. Sorry I didn’t realize this was...yeah sorry. She closes the door and walks off and just as she does Ze is coming towards her. Zelda looks incredible and is wearing some giant floor le gown/cape thing which is extreme and would look not absur exactly four people on earth and she is one of them.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: Becky Something. As I live and breath.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: (flustered, eternally uncool next to Zelda) Zee. Hey. I was uh, I’s looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: What’s it all about? Are you guys on soon? I'll be honest, I never thought I’d see the day.  47 103.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: You and me both, girl.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: You look good. Really good.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Ummmmm. . .

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: Looking for me?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Oh, uh. I mean you can say no and you probably will but I’m going to have a little seance right now. Very pure, really find a clearing on my path before we go, like, do this thing. I know it’s just this song and I know it’s not about me but I want some women around me to help--- She is rambling. Zelda gets it and tries to sooth Becky.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: Relax. I’d love to. Everything's cool. Time passes. They turn and start walking to Becky’s dressing room. The walk in silence, Zelda nearly floating on whatever specia air she breaths and Becky, shorter and more anxious than Zelda has ever been. They enter Something She’s room. THE VENUE, BECKY’S DRESSING ROOM - CONTINUOUS 47 Becky moves her fingers like a conductor but she is summo all the women into a circle. She puts her hands down, motioning for everybody to take one another’s hands. Becky starts setting up. Her belief in mysticism is still powerful. She places small items, crystals, rocks, glass, the hands of all the women, puts ribbons on them and drap cloth over a stool in the center. She lights some smoking thing atop it. She has formed a prayer circle. Everybody eyes one another silently, going with it. It’s reminiscent of AA where people take hands. It shows Becky belief in powers and a program that has worked for her. Focus on Becky as she does finishing touches. It’s clear: is feeling weak right now and is putting this on to suppo herself in a time of crisis. The circle nears completion. Becky takes her place between Mari and Ali.  104. One by one, we see the faces of the six other women, star and ending with Becky. They look at one another with confidence, dedication, style and togetherness. Becky tak final silent pause, closes her eyes, and others follow su Becky is humming, some form of Ya-Ema’s chanting. Nobody joins. But after a moment, Becky speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: I am Rebecca Adamczyk. I rely on the strength of others for support. Thank you all for being here with me. Silence. Then:

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: I am Mary Louise Heller. I am here for you. Thank you all for being here with me.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: I’m Alexandra Derringer. I am here for you. Thank you all for being here with me.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: I am Caroline Schlesinger. I am here for you Thank you all for being here with me.

dialogues.speaker: DOTTIE
dialogues.text: I am Danielle Zakien. I am here for you. Thank you all for being here with me.

dialogues.speaker: ROXIE
dialogues.text: I am Rochelle White. I am here for you. Thank you all for being here with me.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: I am Zelda Ellen Benson-Hartman. I am here for you. Thank you all for being here with me. One face to another. Ritualistic. Calm and beautiful, to these women together, no energy, no attitude. After a mom

dialogues.speaker: DOTTIE
dialogues.text: Your name really is Zelda?

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: Uh huh.  105.

dialogues.speaker: DOTTIE
dialogues.text: Fuck that’s so cool. Everybody laughs, smiles, except Becky, who is still thinking. Open their eyes. Enjoy the feeling this has giv Becky looks like she is about to say something but closes mouth. She turns to leave the room and gives everybody a look. Finally, at the last moment, she turns back.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: No matter what happens next, thank you for letting me be who I am. I’ve tried and I’ve tried and I’ve tried and you all stuck with me. Until the very end. Becky exits. The women are still feeling good.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: I should finish getting ready. Thanks for letting me crash. I know I wasn’t always front row at the Becky Show.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: C’mon. You’ve been backstage at the Becky Show. Zelda blows double kisses with both hands and exits.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: See you in a few.

dialogues.speaker: ROXIE
dialogues.text: We should change. Still all gross.

dialogues.speaker: DOTTIE
dialogues.text: We're watching your set though.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Oh shit, yeah. That’s the one thing I absolutely can’t miss tonight.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Hope we don’t disappoint.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Never!

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: (breaking out of a thoughtful silence) What do you think she meant by ‘until the very end’?  106.

dialogues.speaker: ROXIE
dialogues.text: It’s just a thing people say.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Yeah. Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: What? You think...?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: I mean what did we just do? What did Becky want from us?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIE
dialogues.text: Strength to overcome?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Or?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: No. She...she’s...not now.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: I hope you're right.

dialogues.speaker: THE VENUE, CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Zelda is walking down the hall. A roadie approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM ROADIE
dialogues.text: Miss Z, can I get you anything?

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: No, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM ROADIE
dialogues.text: If you need anything, don’t hesitate to ask.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: Thank you, sweetheart. Zelda floats away: Becky as she could have been. All the fame, the talent, none of the problems. Zelda turns a corner and sees Danny, Tiffany (with round pregnant belly), Ania with Tama, Lauren and Ali’s husband (scruffy fellow with a beard). Another roadie is showing to a private area to watch the show.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Danny!  107.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Zelda. Hi.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER ROADIE
dialogues.text: Talent only, that way.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: They're with me. They hug and Lauren and Zelda give a more intimate hello, showing that in the last five years they hang out sometim

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Ania) You must be Becky’s mother. From down the hall I thought you were her.

dialogues.speaker: ANIA
dialogues.text: Oh stop.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: True story. Zelda is so charming and makes people so happy.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: You remember my wife, Tiffany.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: TIFFANY
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: How’s radio, Dirtbag?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Ha. Good. Merging with competition. Payout. Can’t complain. You seen the girls?

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: I just came from their room. You want me to show where it is?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I think I remember the way.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: They're taking us to the balcony.  49 108.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: Nonsense. Watch from back here. C’mon, let me take you. (to roadie) It’s fine. I’ve got them. She leads the group back where she came from.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Roy) I’m Zelda.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Roy.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: Ali is such a beautiful singer. I always knew. I love the record you two did.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Ah. You’re the one.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: Stop. It’s marvelous. Really. And here you are. See you all soon. She stops at the dressing room and keeps walking, exiting

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back into the Something She room. Only Mari is here. She the group and wonders what’s going on.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Plus ones looking for plus funs.

dialogues.speaker: ANIA
dialogues.text: Where’s Rebecca? Mari kisses Ania hello, same to Danny.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Hey Tiffany. Congrats. (to Tama) Hi darling.

dialogues.speaker: TAMA
dialogues.text: Aunt Mari!  50 51 109.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: She went to unwind or something before we play.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Which is when?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Ten minutes? Nobody is as concerned as they were in Acts 1, 2 and 3. A the lack of concern makes people concerned.

dialogues.speaker: MARI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She's probably meditating or something. The first roadie comes in, clipboard in hand.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM ROADIE
dialogues.text: Eight minutes until Something She.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Eight? Jeez okay let me go look for her. Um, you all wait here. THE VENUE, CORRIDOR —- CONTINUOUS 50 Mari walks to another room, quickly, with purpose and wor

dialogues.speaker: THE VENUE, CATERING ROOM
dialogues.text: Ali is here with Vivvy at a table of food, wine, champagn and other celebratory provisions. It’s lavishly catered.

dialogues.speaker: VIVVY
dialogues.text: Mari. Hey.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Hey V. You guys seen Becky?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Not since she left.

dialogues.speaker: VIVVY
dialogues.text: I saw her.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: VIVVY
dialogues.text: Like two minutes ago. In our room.  52 110.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: But you’re here.

dialogues.speaker: VIVVY
dialogues.text: Yeah I left.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Right but when?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Nothing. I mean, come with me?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Excuse us. They exit the room and we follow them. THE VENUE, CORRIDOR —- CONTINUOUS 52

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: I’m sure it’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: You see how stoned Vivvy was?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: So? That's Vivvy.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Becky shouldn’t be hanging with her.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: I think they just said hey.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: It’s not good to be around that.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: C'mon. Give her the benefit. She's probably in our room.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Was just there. That’s why I’m here.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: She’s somewhere else then. Relax. You’re nervous about the show.  111.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: You're probably right. It’s nuts that we're here at all.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: No kidding. They share a brief moment of victory and pride in the jou that has led them to this point. Instantly, Howard appears around a corner with a champagn bottle.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Have we lost Becky already?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: And that is the big question of the moment.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I'll have a stroke! I was joking. Goddamnit not this again ahhh sonofabitch where is she?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Around. Relaxing, we assume.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Zelda said we could switch with her if we need more time.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: One smooth night. After all these years is that too much?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: I’m sure she’s back by now.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I’ll say hello to Danny. They walk back to the Something She dressing room. Vivvy crosses opposite with several others loopy and in party m Mari studies this: she doesn’t like how the signs are pil up. There’s a chill, a tension here that walking behind Howard, Mari and Ali express to one another.  53 112.

dialogues.speaker: THE VENUE, DRESSING ROOM
dialogues.text: This is all getting very fast again. We’re heading back t the speed of Act 1. Present in the room: Ali, Mari, Howar Danny, Tiffany, Lauren, Roy. Everybody looks around. There’s tension mounting. A roadi pops his head in. Howard puts the bottle down.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM ROADIE
dialogues.text: Five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Tama had to use the bathroom so Ania said she’d look there.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: With the Akergirls?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Negative. Just saw them.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Vivvy?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: TIFFANY
dialogues.text: This isn’t because I’m here, is it?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: We're long past that.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Is she already at the stage?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: First time for everything, I guess. Lauren takes Mari’s hand. Roy takes Ali’s. Everybody is b silent, trying hard not to say it.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Do we have faith?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: She’s earned it.  113.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: She has. The last few weeks have been great, actually.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: She stayed with us upstate. It was rad.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: It’s the old Becky.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Which Old Becky, though? Silence.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: The good one.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: We have to play. So let’s go to the stage and we’ll find Becky waiting there. Ali and Mari lead the group out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: THE VENUE, CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: We follow the big train of people.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: We'll let you do your thing. (to Roy) Let’s get our seats.

dialogues.speaker: TIFFANY
dialogues.text: I’1l come with. Mari kisses Lauren and they break off with Tiffany, who kisses Danny, seeing how nervous and unhappy he is.

dialogues.speaker: THE VENUE, BEHIND THE STAGE
dialogues.text: Cut away to the back of Becky’s head. Far away. Isolated. Mysterious. (Act 4 type moment.) It’s slow motion, curiou and different from how the rest of things move here. We can’t see her face. We drift with her and see that she with guitar, strap on shoulder, She is looking out at the stage as it calls to her for the first time in many years  56 57 114. From behind Becky, you see the gang approaching. We see h see them but it’s still far enough away to be mysterious. Nobody can see her face because she is lit from behind.

dialogues.speaker: THE VENUE, CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Back to the group.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Holy shit look. She’s there. She’s ready. Roadie pops in.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM ROADIE
dialogues.text: Four minutes!

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: We were right.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Why is she standing like that?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: She’s nervous. I know I am. Danny registers something slightly off. He isn’t sure wha

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: She’s nervous. She’s alone.

dialogues.speaker: THE VENUE, BEHIND THE STAGE
dialogues.text: Back behind Becky who hasn’t waved or moved yet. It plays like she might be paralyzed with anxiety and it isn’t unt now, when we see from behind Becky that people are finall pretty close to her that, one by one, in close up and in motion, we individually see people are they come closer a Becky steps one step forward into the light. We see: Howard and Danny. Ali and Mari. Each shows differ emotions, from confusion to relief to uncertainty. Becky remains far away, backlit by a spotlight.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: We need to go to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mari and Ali walk towards Becky. We stay behind, watching three women from afar, the perspective of spectators. Still silent. Still calm. Slow. See people’s reactions ag This moment is about seeing Danny and Howard. Their faces unambiguously ambiguous. Each is certain of something els the worst. The best. Nobody knows for sure. From a distance we see the emotional huddle of Something Becky is shuffling. Mari is strong and confident as she p Becky’s head on her shoulder. Ali seems more reluctant to embrace. It’s not clear what is being said but it is clea what is happening: they trust one and love one another. Mari and Ali look Becky in the eyes and clearly she gives definitive answer. They pause. Her head is forcefully nodding, even though she seems wobbly and weak. Becky and Mari walk back to Howard and Danny.

dialogues.speaker: MARI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM ROADIE
dialogues.text: Three minutes!

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: She’1l be fine? What does that mean she'll be fine? Is she straight? Is she messed up? Can she perform?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: She’s good. We’re good.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Find Zelda! See if she can go on. The roadie runs to find Zelda.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Zelda isn’t going on now. We are. Everybody looks at Becky: nervous, by the stage. Becky looks up as Ania and Tama return from the bathroom. pauses: the appearance of her mother and daughter make Be freeze. She looks directly at them. Ania sees her in the backlight, wobbly and loopy. She loo like she knows something nobody else knows about Becky.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Tell me. What does this mean?  116.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: It means what you want it to mean, Danny boy.

dialogues.speaker: ANIA
dialogues.text: Does she-- has she taken anything? Tama runs from the group over to Becky. We go with her, swooping towards Becky, getting close, finally. Becky swoops up Tama, so energized and happy to finally s her mom play for a crowd. This happiness makes Becky brea

dialogues.speaker: TAMA
dialogues.text: I wanna say good luck before your concert mommy. She kisses Becky. At this, Becky breaks down. Not into te but into herself. It all goes in rather than coming out. Danny, Ania, Howard, Mari and Ali have all come to Becky She hands Tama to Danny and with the weight of a world of shame crushing her, faces her supporters.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: At the end I have to be me. I caused a lot of pain and I’m sorry. I was so nervous. I am so nervous. I don’t know how to go out there like that. All by myself. Rambling in her own stream of thoughts, newly laden with regret, disappointment, sadness and a sense of self aware we've never seen before. Everybody moves towards her, not angry, but with love. Ready to embrace her, because that’ all she ever wanted or needed.

dialogues.speaker: ANIA
dialogues.text: All I ever wanted was for you to be yourself. The roadie comes back with Zelda.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM ROADIE
dialogues.text: Forty five seconds. Forty five to show. Zelda looks at what is happening and tries to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: Oh Becky. Becky, darling. Are you okay?  117.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Things are okay. Things will be okay. She looks to Mari and Ali. They are there for her. Everybody is confused, but there’s nothing more to say. T are no answers here, except one: the show must go on.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM ROADIE
dialogues.text: We are ready for Something She in Thirty. Danny and Ania step aside. The band stays together. Zelda off to the side by the roadie.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: We should go.

dialogues.speaker: ANIA
dialogues.text: Leave?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: No. Go watch the show. They exit. Mari and Ali face Becky. Just the three of the

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM ROADIE
dialogues.text: Fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: Are we okay? Becky nods, a little weakly.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM ROADIE
dialogues.text: Ten, nine, eight, seven...

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Rebecca never went on stage exposed and alone. She never knew how.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: You’re not on your own.

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: You never were on your own.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM ROADIE
dialogues.text: Three, two, one. Show time folks. That’s a cue for Something She.  He motions to the stage and the house lights go down spotlight hits the on stage microphone. RANDOM ROADIE (CONT’D) Howard? Introduce the band. Howard looks at Becky, unsure what to do.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: It’s okay. I’m ready to go. 118. anda Ali and Mari nod to him to go. Howard steps to the stage the perspective of him remains in the wings as he starts talking. We hear his story while mostly watching Becky, M and Ali hold one another’s hands and faces and get ready.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I first saw this next band...almost ten, god, no, eleven years ago. They were opening for, well, it doesn’t matter who they were opening for because I left right after their set. Ran backstage. Dropped to my knees and begged to let me sign them. And this woman, this once in a lifetime, never been anyone like her in the world, fire brand of a woman, her hair dyed bright blue, looks down at me, a desperate pathetic adult man ina leather jacket and no established career, a label that I ran out of my mother’s basement, begging to work with her. And at this time, she’s a nobody. Keep in mind, this was maybe their ninth show. And you know what she does? She looks me in the eye and says ‘Who the fuck are you to want to work with a star like me?’ (CROWD LAUGHTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This woman, who had nothing, nobody even knew her name, made me beg. Tortured me for months as I pursued her, followed her, sweetening the offer until finally she gave me a chance to talk terms. So we plan to meet for breakfast. She shows up at two and I realize we've only ever spoken at shows. The band is hung over as hell, and I probably was too. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She sits down and looks me in the eye after months of making me chase, beg, everything, she looks at me and she says ‘who are you again and what is this about?’ (CROWD LAUGHTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are still on Becky, Ali and Mari. Zelda is behind them Becky looks up to the balcony/VIP area at Tama and this g her strength to get her head straight, close her eyes and focus. She gives her head to Ali and Mari and they hold h

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We've been together ever since. Through the ups, the downs, a friendly lawsuit or two, but mostly, it’s the good times I think about. Both of them. (CROWD LAUGHTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love and respect the hell out of these and am proud to call them family. Please give a Paragon welcome, together for the first time in nearly four years: Becky Something, Ali Van Der Wolff and Marielle Hell. Ladies and gentlemen: SOMETHING SHE! The crowd goes insane. It’s unreal to see these women together again. Howard gestures to the stage and Becky freezes like a deer in headlights. She looks out at him, the spotlights, the audience, hears applause and she can’t move. Mari and Ali are by her side

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Is it today? Is today the day I don’t make it?

dialogues.speaker: MARI
dialogues.text: No. Today is not the day.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: We're with you. THE VENUE, THE STAGE — CONTINUOUS 58 Something She takes the stage and it’s nuts. Totally elec and you feel the excitement of them being together. It fe iconic because it really is. People never thought it woul happen, including Mari and Ali.  120. Becky looks up at Tama, who gives her a big happy thumbs and Becky catches it with a kiss and puts it in her pocke The applause goes on and it hits Becky as strong as huge of anything she’s ever taken. Whatever she was dealing wi the anxiety, the years of recovery, it’s nothing compared this. She becomes old Becky: arms out receiving the love, begging for more. Eating it up. Ali and Mari are beaming and all three embrace for a pre pose and flash bulbs are exploding and the stage lighting dramatic and colorful and it’s amazing and Becky is reall happy and looks luminescent in the spotlight. She steps to the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Where ya been? WILD APPLAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh and thanks Howard for the bullshit story because I don’t remember it happening like that at all. Side of the stage: Howard laughs and finds another mic.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Do you remember it at all?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: I do remember the blue hair. (LAUGHTER FROM CROWD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh but what to say what to say what to say! Okay so I know this is all about Howard but I’ve heard enough kind things about him to last a lifetime and those are the ones he says about himself. (LAUGHTER FROM CROWD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I dunno what else is there? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I used to think of myself as an island and it took me a lifetime to realize that without people like these women beside me nobody is nothin’ and I dunno if you heard but I haven't exactly done this lately and I’m like a little pee shy or whatever and I know I didn’t ask them about this and Howard if I know you you’ve got some big bullshit finale planned and I wasn’t included and I don’t wanna ruin it bit I’m gonna because I’ve been through some shit and there’s lotsa people who I wouldn’t be here without and only like eight of em are here and only like four of em are musicians not in this band so if Crassy Cassie, Roxie Rotten, Dottie 0.Z. and cause I am full of love tonight, Zelda E. Zekial care to come up on stage and help me stumble through this bullshit? Becky is wired and, drugs or no drugs, she is fun, energe and workable. Not a disaster. The crowd goes more insane for this super group gathering one by one these women come out and bow to the applause. Becky hugs each one and makes eye contact with Danny, Ani and Tama (near Lauren, Tiffany and Roy) in the balcony. She puts her arm around Zelda and steps to the mic and is bursting with adrenaline and might explode.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cut the bullshit and love each other, okay? People applaud and cannot wait to hear music and Zelda ki Becky. It’s really complete to see a rivalry buried publi Becky pulls the women in and huddles, muttering the plan. They take positions and the Akergirls get instruments and Zelda gets a tambourine or some noisy hand instrument and Becky and Mari and Ali exchange a warm and loving look an Ali gives a drumstick count and the song starts. It’s rousing, singalong ready. Everybody can take half a verse and sing together, beautifully, on the choruses. Tw minute long burst of pure punk and the song has a narrati about the ups and downs of being on tour in a band with nothing. One by one they share the mic to tell this story (the song is written by Alicia Bognanno/Bully)  122.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I stopped counting Lost track of time Ran out of patience I know what’s mine, I know what’s mine You get me angry You read me wrong I kinda like it. Kills to belong, kills to belong. If I don’t breath I can feel her barely walking Take over me She’s alive and I’m on to something I’d give ten years for a piece of her mind I would I’d give a hundred just to hit rewind My hands are easy And my aim is blind Resist the feeling Control my mind, control my mind. I beg politely. To lie alone Nothing’s forever. This much I know. This much I know. If I don’t breath I can feel her barely walking Take over me She’s alive and I’m on to something I’d give ten years for a piece of her mind I would I’d give a hundred just to hit rewind If I don’t breath....If I don’t breath... It’s so fucking awesome and the crowd goes insane at the Glorious beyond all belief. From the stage wings, Howard cheering and deeply touched. (The VIP area: Ania, Danny, Tiffany, Lauren and Roy love Danny makes quick eye contact with Becky and takes Tama through an exit door.) All seven women bow and things are so positive and Becky sweating like crazy and on her face there’s tears with th sweat and she falls into a loving embrace with Mari and A who has come out from behind the kit. Zelda and the Akergirls step back to let Something She ha this. Becky hugs all of them and the moment feels complet Becky has been occupied with where Danny was headed and i laser focused on it and without saying anything walks off quickly to intercept them. Drifting away from the victory  59 123. Mari and Ali leave the stage and walk past Howard who doe know what will happen, alone now. The crowd is chanting:

dialogues.speaker: THE VENUE, BEHIND THE STAGE
dialogues.text: Stay with Becky, behind her, hoping to catch Danny. She o makes it a few steps before seeing him standing there wit her daughter. He is proud and hands Tama to Becky once ag Becky is standing in the exact same spot off the side of stage where she was in the first shot of the movie, pre encore, and just like then the crowd is chanting.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: She holds Tama who is happy and smiling because she’s nev seen her mom be so wild and has never heard rock before s this is her first concert and first exposure to rock.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Did you see mommy up there?

dialogues.speaker: TAMA
dialogues.text: Best song I ever saw! Becky is woozy from adrenaline (and maybe more) and holds Tama close to her. She can’t stand up. She leans on the w

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Momma is gonna be better, baby, for you. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Mari and Ali have been watching Becky with Tama. Everybody knows that Becky only needed to get this one th out of the way to move on with the rest of her life. Beck Something, on stage again. Drugs or no. Sober on stage fo the first time or simply back on stage after years away. It’s all mostly over now. She’s not a junkie, really, anymore. But recovery is a long process and Danny, Mari, Ali all know that and know that they need to be supportiv Becky right now, as they always have been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard comes back to find them. He looks so excited.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: They want more. You got one more? Becky looks at Mari and Ali and then down at Tama, just holding her mom’s chest and being so happy because she no loves rock and roll.

dialogues.speaker: TAMA
dialogues.text: Go play more momma! Becky pauses and thinks. Mari and Ali are ready to go for more. Becky is now clear headed and determined once again Becky looks around at her loved ones. The crowd keeps chanting as Mari and Ali embrace and look like acceptance peace have found them at last.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: No. That’s all I got. It’s over. Becky holds Tama and closes her eyes as she leans back on wall. END OF ACT FIVE. THE END.
